review_title: Great international students ready to accept learning challenges
job_title: Adjunct Professor in San Diego, CA
pros: Encourages continuing staff development; freedom to establish your own curriculum
cons: Lack of student parking results in many students being late for class or cutting clas altogether

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
cons: This company is shady in how they operate.
Lots of turnover at this job

review_title: Great place to launch and grow your career in higher education administration.
job_title: Administrative Staff in San Diego, CA
pros:
Family-like environment, start-up atmosphere, friendly staff and management. Using a very personable attention-to-client-needs approach, rather than using predatory tactics to increase the student body.
I am a member of admin staff, and I want to say that like every small business, there is always room for improvements, but things are developing in the right direction, and it is an overall great place to work at
cons: Size - the institution is still very small, so there are limited career growth options. However, I see a great deal of potential for the school to grow in the future, so the career growth possibilities are going to improve greatly.

pros: In every business there will always be someone who says they aren't happy where they work. I say look at the person who is saying. Any career is what you make it. I loved working here. Everyone was nice and I loved my students.
cons: My only wish is that Admin would treat the Teachers with a a bit more respect, and I imagine vice-versa... Pay could be a bit higher too. No benefits for the teachers, even thought the school is accredited.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Old Town San Diego, CA
pros: This school serves an international student body. This mean classes are a bit more demanding, but also very rewarding. Classes tend to be smaller, which leads to more opportunity to interact with students.  The admin have regular staff meetings to keep staff informed
cons: Parking is tight because it is in the very popular Old Town area.

review_title: I do not recommend this company
pros: The location is beautiful in Old town. The students are wonderful.
cons: There are so many problems with this company.They have the highest turnover I have ever seen. The owner does not believe in investing in her employees - everyone is replaceable. There is very low morale. The employees work very hard for very low wages compared to other schools in the area. The employees and students do not feel like the administration cares for them.  It is an unorganized management system. Money always comes first before resolving any issues.

review_title: Very unprofessional and not truly an educational institution.
pros: It is in a beautiful city, near Old Town and the students are good.
cons: They are very unprofessional and attempt to be something they are not.  The management is more concerned about the I-20 issue than they are about teaching.  The qualifications of the faculty is questionable.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: I've been working here for many years and I have nothing to complain about it. It is a great place to work, schedule is very flexible if needed. I'd say it is like family.
cons: nothing to complain abut the company.

review_title: Not recommended. Staff cares only about $ from students who pay to stay on visas
pros: Not much good to say.  I didn't expect a lot but was pretty disappointed nonetheless.
cons: School is basically a student visa dealer masquerading as a university.  Most students have no goals but school lets them stay for years on visas.
